page.title: Minister for Business, Fair Work and Skills

revision.text:
{{Politics of Scotland}} The '''Minister for Business, Fair Work and Skills''' is a [[Junior minister]]ial post in the [[Scottish Government]]. As a result, the Minister does not attend[http://www.opsi.gov.uk/acts/acts1998/ukpga_19980046_en_1 Scotland Act (1998)], ''Only those appointed under Section 47 of the Scotland Act "attend" Cabinet. Junior ministers are appointed under Section 49 and may be "present".'' the [[Government of the 4th Scottish Parliament|Scottish Cabinet]]. The post was retitled in June 2018: the Minister supports the [[Cabinet Secretary for Finance, Economy and Fair Work]] and the [[Cabinet Secretary for Education and Skills]], both of whom are members of cabinet.{{cite web|url=https://beta.gov.scot/about/who-runs-government/cabinet-and-ministers/minister-business-fair-work-skills/|title=Minister for Business, Fair Work and Skills|date=2018-06-27|accessdate=2018-06-27|publisher=Scottish Government}} The Minister for Business, Fair Work and Skills has specific responsibility for: *Business, industry and manufacturing *Employment policy *Labour market strategy, the living wage, and fair work *Employability programmes *Youth employment (including implementation of the Wood Commission recommendations) *Women's employment *Bankruptcy and Accountant in Bankruptcy (Scottish government agency) *Regional economic forums *Partnership Action for Continuing Employment (PACE) *Non-advanced vocational skills *Skills Development Scotland (Scotland's national skills agency) *Consumer protection == List of office holders == The current Minister for Business, Fair Work and Skills is [[Jamie Hepburn]]. {|class="wikitable" cellpadding="6" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 0 0 0 1em; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaaaaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; " |colspan="8"| === Minister for Enterprise, Energy and Tourism === |- !colspan="2"|Name ! width=75|Portrait !Entered Office !Left Office !Party !First Minister |- |{{Scottish politics/party colours/Scottish National Party}}| |[[Jim Mather]] |[[File:Jim Mather, Minister for Enterprise, Energy and Tourism (2).jpg|75px]] |17 May 2007 |20 May 2011 |[[Scottish National Party]] |[[Alex Salmond]] |- |colspan="8"| === Minister for Business, Energy and Tourism === |- |{{Scottish politics/party colours/Scottish National Party}}| |[[Fergus Ewing]] |[[File:Fergus Ewing, Minister for Community Safety (2).jpg|75px]] |20 May 2011 |18 May 2016 |[[Scottish National Party]] |[[Alex Salmond]]
[[Nicola Sturgeon]] |- |colspan="8"| === Minister for Business, Innovation and Energy === |- |{{Scottish politics/party colours/Scottish National Party}}| |[[Paul Wheelhouse]] |[[File:PaulWheelhouseMSP20110507.JPG|75px]] |18 May 2016 |27 June 2018 |[[Scottish National Party]] |[[Nicola Sturgeon]] |- |colspan="8"| === Minister for Business, Fair Work and Skills === |- |{{Scottish politics/party colours/Scottish National Party}}| |[[Jamie Hepburn]] |[[File:JamieHepburnMSP20110511.JPG|75px]] |27 June 2018 |''Incumbent'' |[[Scottish National Party]] |[[Nicola Sturgeon]] |} ==History== From 1999 to 2007, enterprise and energy were the responsibility of the '''Minister for Enterprise and Lifelong Learning'''. The [[Second McConnell government]] from 2003 to 2007 instituted Tourism as a portfolio, combined with Culture and Sport, as the '''Minister for Tourism, Culture and Sport'''. The [[Government of the 3rd Scottish Parliament|Salmond government]], elected following the [[Scottish Parliament election, 2007]] created the junior post of '''Minister for Enterprise, Energy and Tourism''' by combining the roles. In November 2014 his post became the '''Minister for Business, Energy and Tourism''', as part of the [[first Sturgeon government]]. The post was retitled as '''Minister for Business, Innovation and Energy''' as part of the [[second Sturgeon government]], and renamed again in June 2018 to Business, Fair Work and Skills. ==See also== *[[Scottish Parliament]] ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.gov.scot/About/People/Ministers/Minister-Business-Innovation-Energy Minister for Business, Innovation and Energy] on Scottish Government website {{Junior Scottish Government Ministers}} {{Tourism in the United Kingdom}} [[Category:Ministerial posts of the Scottish Government|Business, Fair Work and Skills]] [[Category:Economy of Scotland]] [[Category:Business in Scotland]] {{Scotland-gov-stub}}

{{Redirect|NDIA|other uses|Ndia (disambiguation){{!}}Ndia}} {{Infobox organization |name = National Defense Industrial Association |image = NDIA2017logo.svg |image_border = |size = |caption = |map = |msize = |mcaption = |abbreviation = NDIA |motto = Strength through Industry and Technology{{cn|date=August 2018}} |formation = 1919 |extinction = |type = Voluntary association |status = |purpose = Promote US national security |headquarters = [[Arlington, Virginia]] |location = [[United States]] |region_served = [[United States]] |membership = Corporate, Individual and Life |language = |leader_title = President |leader_name = Hawk Carlisle |main_organ = |parent_organization = |affiliations = Association For Enterprise Integration (AFEI)
National Training and Simulation Association (NTSA)
Precision Strike Association (PSA)
Women in Defense (WID) |num_staff = 75 |num_volunteers = |budget = |website = [http://www.ndia.org www.ndia.org] |remarks = }} The '''National Defense Industrial Association''' ('''NDIA''') is an [[voluntary association|association]] for the [[Federal government of the United States|United States government]] and the [[defense industry]].{{cite web|last=Dao|first=James|title=Dogfight for Dollars On Capitol Hill|work=[[The New York Times]]|publisher= The New York Times Company|date=2001-09-02|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2001/09/02/business/dogfight-for-dollars-on-capitol-hill.html?pagewanted=3|accessdate=2009-07-07|quote=a trade group that represents 900 military contractors}}{{cite book|last=Appelbaum|first=Richard P|authorlink=|author2=William I. Robinson|title=Critical globalization studies|publisher=[[Routledge]]|year=2005|pages=146|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=T7B98k3aHIIC|isbn=0-415-94961-0|quote=The main military manufacturers' organization, National Defense Industrial Association, has 9000 corporate affiliates and 36000 individual members with no foreign membership. The association maintains close coordination with the DOD functioning through thirty-four committees, each with direct access to and a working relationship with the military. Divided up amongst these contactors is the largest single slice of the federal government budget. Current military spending has hit $383 billion with $62 billion for procurement and $51 billion in research and development.}}{{cite book|title=Congressional Quarterly, v.63, nos. 1-9|publisher=[[Times Publishing Company]]|pages=10|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=V06GAAAAMAAJ&q=%22National+Defense+Industrial+Association%22|quote=The Aerospace Industries Association and the National Defense Industrial Association are the two biggest industry lobbyists.}} Based in [[Arlington, Virginia]], NDIA was established in 1919 as a result of the inability of the defense industry to scale up the war effort during World War I. It connects government officials, military and industry professionals, and organizations that represent the branches of the [[Military of the United States|armed forces]], homeland security, and first responders. The NDIA publishes a magazine, the ''[[National Defense (magazine)|National Defense]]'', and holds over 80 symposia a year. ==Organization== The group has approximately 1,600 corporate members and over 65,000 individual and government members. Affiliated members include the [[Association for Enterprise Information]] (AFEI), the [[National Training and Simulation Association]] (NTSA), the [[Precision Strike Association]] (PSA), and [[Women in Defense (organisation)|Women in Defense]] (WID). It connects government officials, military and industry professionals, and organizations that represent the branches of the [[US military|armed forces]], homeland security, and first responders. It has divisions and working groups covering several niche areas. Its members often use the organization to forge business contacts through networking and participating in national and local events. Logistics, policy, combat, and acquisition form the base for most symposia, over 80 are held annually. Defense professionals from the private industry, government, military and first responders from the public and private sectors attend these programs for information from subject matter experts and to make contacts in industry and government. About 25 exhibitions each year include defense-related industry and government exhibits. These events and exhibitions are designed to facilitate information sharing and networking opportunities. The association publishes a magazine, the ''[[National Defense (magazine)|National Defense]]''. Recently, they created a STEM (science, technology, engineering and math) Division, promoting educational opportunities for youth to ensure a skilled technical work force, and developing cutting-edge manufacturing techniques to support the military industry.{{cite web|url=http://www.tradeandindustrydev.com/issues/ID-385-article.aspx|title=NDIA Expands Opportunities for Defense Professionals |last=Farrell Jr.|first=Lawrence P. |publisher=Trade and Industry Development|accessdate=2009-05-17}} The Technical Information Division has responsibility for the NDIA configuration and data management (CDM) professional certification program. This includes preparation training for certification, the administration of examinations, and the award of certifications. NDIA has established two CDM certification levels: Certified Configuration and Data Manager (CCDM) and Certified Configuration and Data Specialist (CCDS). ==Chapters== {{As of|2009}}, NDIA has 28 chapters across the United States.{{cite web|url=http://www.ndia.org/MembershipAndChapters/NDIAChapters/Pages/NDIA_Chapter_Presidents.aspx|title=NDIA Chapter Presidents|publisher=National Defense Industrial Association|accessdate=2009-05-17}} == Divisions == NDIA consists of 28 Divisions and seven Industrial Working Groups that aims to promote defense through access, influence and education.{{cite web|url=http://www.ndia.org/DIVISIONS/Pages/default.aspx|title=Divisions|publisher=National Defense Industrial Association|accessdate=2009-05-17}} {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="4" | Divisions |- | Armaments | Bomb & Warhead | Chemical, Biological, Radiological and Nuclear (CBRN) Defense | Combat Survivability |- | Cyber-Augmented Operations (CAO) | Cybersecurity | Electronics | Expeditionary Warfare |- | Health Affairs | Human Systems | Integrated Program Management | International |- | Logistics Management | Manufacturing | Missile Defense | Munitions Technology |- | Procurement | Robotics | Science and Engineering Technology | Small Business |- | Space | Special Operations/Low Intensity Conflict | Strike, Land Attack, and Air Defense (SLAAD) | Systems Engineering |- | Tactical Wheeled Vehicles | Technical Information | Test and Evaluation | Undersea Warfare |} ;Industrial Working Groups * Chemical Biological Defense Acquisition Initiatives Forum * Committee of Small Arms Producers * Industrial Committee of Ammunition Producers * Industrial Committee of Tank and Automotive Producers * Industrial Committee on Operational Test and Evaluation * Industrial Committee for Program Management * Industrial Committee on Biometrics ==See also== * [[Military–industrial complex]] ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Military industry]] [[Category:United States military associations]] [[Category:Modeling and simulation]]

{{EngvarB|date=September 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} {{Infobox person |name = Naushad N. Merali |image = |image_size = |caption = |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1951|01|02}} |birth_place = Nairobi, Kenya |spouse = Zarin (wife) |death_date = |death_place = |death_cause = |resting_place = |residence = [[Nairobi]], Kenya |nationality = Kenya |known_for = Being one of the wealthiest residents in Kenya and operating numerous business ventures |occupation = Businessman, [[Industrialist]] |networth = [[US$|$]]210 million (November 2011)<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/mfonobongnsehe/2011/11/16/10-african-millionaires-to-watch/#4d26284346ab|title=10 African Millionaires To Watch|last=Nsehe|first=Mfonobong|work=Forbes|access-date=2018-06-07|language=en}}</ref> |home_town = }}
'''Naushad N. Merali, CBS''' (born 2 January 1951 in [[Nairobi]], Kenya) is the founder of the Kenyan mobile service provider [http://kencell.co.ke Kencell] along with French media giant [[Vivendi]].<ref name="merali">[https://www.forbes.com/sites/mfonobongnsehe/2011/11/16/10-african-millionaires-to-watch/ ''Naushad Merali''] information at Forbes.com</ref> He attended [[Highway Secondary School]] in the suburbs of [[Nairobi]], Kenya. As one of Kenya's leading [[industrialists]], Merali has brought commercial development in Kenya for more than 30 years and is constantly expanding his businesses throughout East Africa.<ref>[http://www.changes-challenges.org/NMerali ''Naushad M. Merali''] information at Changes-Challenges.org</ref>
His wife is Zarin Merali, who is a director for the Kenyan Paraplegic Organisation.<ref name="orgstructure">[http://www.kenyanparaplegic.com/about-us/organization-structure.html?start=1 ''Zarin Merali''] information at KenyanParalegic.com</ref> She is also an interior design consultant.<ref name="orgstructure"/>
Merali's ancestors were believed to have emigrated from the state of [[Gujarat]] in what is now known as [[India]]. His mother's maiden name is assumed to be [[Patel]]; a surname occupied by famous Indian businessmen and 33% of all American mid-sized hotel owners.<ref>[http://www.kenyanentrepreneur.com/naushad-merali-who-is-this-man?cid=71065 ''Maybe he is a Patel, I hear Indian …''] at Kenyan Entrepreneur</ref><ref name="kamdar">{{cite book|last=Kamdar|first=Mira|title=Planet India: how the fastest-growing democracy is transforming America and the world|year=2007|publisher=Simon and Schuster|isbn=978-0-7432-9685-4|page=29|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=RFPlNrRxaFMC&pg=PA29}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|last=Ungar|first=Sanford J.|title=Fresh blood: the new American immigrants|year=1998|publisher=U of Illinois Press|isbn=978-0-252-06702-0|page=32|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=mwUWHicTMZsC&pg=PA32}}</ref>
==Career== From the 1980s to March 2005, Merali was the director of the now-defunct W.P.H. Kenya Tea company.<ref>[http://www.marsgroupkenya.org/pdfs/august_07/KTM/KTM_report_page_94.pdf ''Report page for W.P.H. Kenya Tea 1994''] at Mars Group Kenya</ref>
In 2004, he managed to purchase 60% ownership of the business from Vivendi for $230 million.<ref name="merali"/> Merali would transfer ownership only an hour later to [[Celtel]] for a $20 million profit.<ref name="merali"/><ref>[http://www.balancingact-africa.com/news/en/issue-no-210/money/the-celtel-purchase/en ''THE CELTEL PURCHASE OF KENCELL – THE STORY BEHIND THE DEAL''] at BalancingAct-Africa.com</ref> While owning 5% of [[Bharti Airtel]]'s Kenyan wireless phone operations, Merali spends his time steering the affairs of the [[Sameer Group]].<ref name="merali"/> The Sameer Group is a [[conglomerate (company)|conglomerate]] of 15 Kenyan companies that range from financial services to agriculture and even information technology.<ref name="merali"/> Three of these companies appear on the [[Nairobi Stock Exchange]] and Merali is worth $210 million as of 2 November 2011.<ref name="merali"/> He is reported to have shares in the [[Commercial Bank of Africa]] as of 2003.<ref name="wapratio">[http://wap.ratio-magazine.com/inner.php?id=266 ''Kenya: Libyan Government to Purchase Equatorial Commercial Bank''] at Ratio-Magazine.com</ref> Merali's purchase of the Grand Regency Hotel during that year caused a lot of controversy in the Kenya area.<ref name="wapratio"/>
Merali also holds positions at the ''Kenya Export Promotion Council'', the ''International Who's Who of Professionals'', and the ''National Investment Council of Kenya''.<ref name="sameergroup">[http://www.sameer-group.com/inner.asp?cat=mgmt&pcat=about ''Naushad Merali''] career information at Sameer-Group.com</ref> The President of Kenya has appointed him to positions such as membership in the ''Kenya Export Promotion Council'', membership in ''The National Poverty Eradication Commission of Kenya'', and membership in ''The Presidential Committee on Employment''.<ref name="sameergroup"/> He appeared at the 2011 [[World Economic Forum]] in [[Davos]] as one of the African delegates along – making him one of the three Kenyan delegates.<ref>[http://www.abndigital.com/page/micro-sites/davos-2011/south-african-delegates/index List of Africa delegates at the 2011 World Economic Forum] at ABNDigital.com</ref> As of September 2011, [[Kenya Data Networks]] – one of his business ventures – is facing financial problems and the shareholders are ready to cause a shakedown in the entire management team.<ref>[http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/InsidePage.php?id=2000043539&cid=457 ''Merali's Midas Touch''] at StandardMedia.co.ke</ref> These financial problems came to frutition by 2013 when Merali relinquished control of the company.
In 2012, Merali invested in construction.<ref>[http://www.africaintelligence.com/ION/business-circles/2012/03/24/naushad-merali-tempted-by-property,99999054-ART ''Naushad Merali tempted by property''] at Africa Intelligence</ref> Two of Merali's former firms, [[Kenya Data Networks]] and Swift Global are in the process of being merged into Great Britain's Liquid Telecoms as of February 2013. Many executive positions could be declared redundant as a result of this multinational merger. Both retail and wholesale services for the lower end of the consumer spectrum were provided by both of these firms as individual companies; as rival Internet service provider [[Safaricom]] already had a firm grasp on the upper end of the market.<ref>[http://www.businessdailyafrica.com/Corporate-News/UK-firm-seeks-nod-to-merge-former-Merali-companies/-/539550/1694490/-/wf61dwz/-/index.html ''UK firm seeks regulator’s nod to merge former Merali companies''] at Business Daily Africa</ref>
== References == {{reflist|2}}

revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=May 2015}} '''Northern bleached softwood kraft''' ('''NBSK''') is the paper industry's benchmark grade of [[wood pulp|pulp]]. Market NBSK is produced mainly in Canada and the [[Nordic countries|Nordic]] countries. Some NBSK is also produced in north-western United States and in Russia. NBSK [[Futures contract|futures]] are traded on the [[Chicago Mercantile Exchange]].
==Properties== This [[Pulp (paper)|pulp]] grade is very diverse. All NBSK pulps have long fibers and is often used as reinforcement pulp.<ref>{{Cite book| last = Nanko | first = Hirko |author2=Button, Allan |author3=Hillman, Dave | title = The World of Market Pulp | publisher = WOMP, LLC | year = 2005 | location = Appleton, WI, USA | pages = 10–13 | url = | doi = | id = | isbn = 0-615-13013-5 }}</ref>
NBSK from [[British Columbia]] is mainly from Lodgepole Pine, with a significant amount of White Spruce. [[Western Red Cedar|Redcedar]], [[douglas fir]], [[Tsuga|hemlock]], and [[larch]] make up a smaller portion of the chip furnish. NBSK is known for having longer fiber lengths and larger fiber diameter than anywhere else in the world due to very long growing season and mild climate.
NBSK from [[Siberia]] is made from [[pine]], spruce and [[european larch]] and tend to be shorter and thinner than other NBSK pulps due to the short growing season. The larch makes up about 15% of the wood furnish and gives a rather coarse fiber that makes Siberian NBSK less desirable as reinforcement pulp.
The only single species NBSK is of plantation [[Radiata pine]] from New Zealand, [[Brazil]] and [[Chile]]. It has good brightness and cleanliness that is appreciated in [[printing and writing paper]]s.
NBSK from [[Scandinavia]] is only from [[scots pine]] and [[norway spruce]] in the normal mix 7:3. The mix might vary much with the season as norway spruce grows on wetter lands that is easier accessed in the winter when the ground is frozen.
==Applications== The most common use of NBSK is as reinforcement fibres when making [[paper]] or as raw material for [[kraft paper]]. It is also used in [[tissue paper]].
==See also== [[Southern bleached softwood kraft]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://quotes.ino.com/exchanges/?r=CME_WP NBSK futures prices]
{{Paper}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Nbsk}} [[Category:Papermaking]] [[Category:Pulp and paper industry]]
{{industry-stub}}

[[File:45 Pierre Bellanger (15453635376).jpg|thumb|right|Pierre Bellanger, 2014]] <!-- Unsourced image removed: [[Image:Pcb3.jpg|thumb|right|Pierre Bellanger]] --> '''Pierre Bellanger''' (born 1958) is founder and CEO of [[Skyrock (radio)|Skyrock]], a French commercial radio station, and founder of [[skyrock (social network site)|skyrock.com]], a French-language social network.
== Biography == Bellanger created Skyrock in 1985 as a national FM station in France. Today, it ranks as the country's most popular radio station among 13- to 24-year-olds, with four million listeners each day.
As a biology student in late 1970s Paris, Bellanger participated in the [[Pirate radio|free radio]] movement that helped to topple the state's monopoly on broadcasting. Since then, as an entrepreneur in media and Internet, he has created a TV station, several radio stations, as well as numerous cable and satellite services. His interactive experience began in the mid-1980s with the [[Minitel]] and phone services. His first Internet company was created in 1994 as a joint venture with France Telecom.
Bellanger is the author of two books: ''The Future of Radio'' (1992) and ''La convergence, c'est le code''<ref>[http://www.skyrock.fm/bellanger/la_convergence_c_est_le_code.pdf La convergence, c'est le code]</ref> (2003). In 2006, the French Ministry of Culture and Communication named him to the Counsel for Strategic Analysis of Cultural and Communications Industries.
In 2004, Bellanger helped to spearhead the French government's introduction of the Dispositif Alerte-Enlèvement, modeled on the North American [[AMBER Alert]] systems.
== Bibliography == * Pierre Bellanger : ''La radio du futur : Les sept défis de la radio commerciale en France'', [[Armand Colin]], (1992) * Pierre Bellanger : ''Ils ont pensé le futur : web social, marketing, e-commerce...'', KAWA * Pierre Bellanger : ''[https://www.amazon.fr/souverainet%C3%A9-num%C3%A9rique-Pierre-Bellanger/dp/2234077354/ La Souveraineté numérique]'', Éditions Stock
== References == {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.skyrock.fm/bellanger/#english Pierre Bellanger on Social Networks]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Bellanger, Pierre}} [[Category:1958 births]] [[Category:French businesspeople]] [[Category:French people of Polish descent]] [[Category:French people of Hungarian descent]] [[Category:Living people]]

{{Other people|Sergey Aslanyan}} {{Infobox person | name = Sergey Aslanyan | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Sergey Gareginovich Aslanyan | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1973|09|18}} | birth_place = [[Yerevan]], [[Soviet Union]] | death_date = | death_place = | residence = [[Moscow]], [[Russia]] | nationality = Russian | other_names = | known_for = | occupation = Chairman, [[MaximaTelecom]] | alma_mater = {{Moscow University|1996}} | networth = }}
'''Sergey Aslanyan''' ({{lang-ru|link=no|Сергей Гарегинович Асланян}}; born September 18, 1973, [[Yerevan]], [[Soviet Union|USSR]]) is a [[Russia]]n businessman and [[Senior management|executive manager]]. He is the founder and Chairman of the Board at [[MaximaTelecom]].
== Biography == Sergey Aslanyan was born in [[Yerevan]], Armenia, graduated from [[MSU Faculty of Computational Mathematics and Cybernetics|Faculty of Computational Mathematics and Cybernetics]] at [[Moscow State University|Lomonosov Moscow State University]]. In 1996 Aslanyan he received a degree in Applied Mathematics.
Aslanyan started his career in 1997 as a senior consultant at the auditing company [[Coopers & Lybrand]], which soon merged with Price Waterhouse and was titled [[PricewaterhouseCoopers]]. In 2001, he joined [[TNK-BP|TNK-BP Management]] in the position of deputy head of the information technology unit.
In December 2003, Aslanyan was invited to join [[MTS (network provider)|Mobile TeleSystems]] as Vice President of Information Technology – this position was created specially for him.<ref name=mts-sostav>{{cite web |url = http://www.sostav.ru/news/2003/12/22/2/ |title = Бывший замруководителя блока информационных технологий ТНК-ВР Сергей Асланян назначен вице-президентом по IT компании МТС |date = 2003-12-22 |publisher = Sostav.ru |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref><ref name=mts-vz>{{cite web |url = http://www.vz.ru/news/2007/10/3/114314.html |title = Сергей Асланян возглавил ОАО "Ситроникс" |date = 2007-10-03 |publisher = [[Vzglyad (newspaper)|Vzglyad newspaper]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-04-16 }}</ref> In July 2006 he was appointed as Vice President of Engineering and Information Technology. He supervised the transition of the telecommunications operator to a new [[Telecommunications billing|billing system]], the implementation of [[Oracle Corporation|Oracle]] [[Enterprise resource planning|ERP]] system and [[Document automation|workflow automation system]], and he was responsible for the integration of companies acquired by MTS network.<ref name=bio-sf>{{cite journal | author = Константин Бочарский | title = Нам нужно пять кварталов, чтобы стать прибыльными | url = http://secretmag.ru/archive/sec-firm_15_210408.pdf | publisher = Secretmag.ru Magazine | date = April 2008 | volume = 15 (247) | issn = 1727-4176 }}</ref>
In October 2007 Aslanyan became president of the [[Sitronics]] group, which belonged to investment holding [[Sistema|JSFC Sistema]] just as Mobile TeleSystems.<ref name=utkin-rbc>{{cite web |url = http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:viwTE-kz-AUJ:rbcdaily.ru/media/562949978980393+&cd=1&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=ru |title = Слово Асланяну |author = Антон Бурсак |date = 2007-10-03 |publisher = [[RBC Information Systems]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref><ref name=sitronics-expert>{{cite web |url = http://expert.ru/expert/2008/16/aslanyan/ |title = Дойные коровы Сергея Асланяна |author = Сергей Скрипников, Елена Рыцарева |date = 2008 |publisher = [[Expert (magazine)|Expert magazine]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref><ref name=sitronics-kommersant>{{cite web |url = http://www.kommersant.ru/doc/810747 |title = Вице-президент МТС стал президентом "Ситроникса" |author = Александра Ходонова |date = 2007-10-03 |publisher = [[Kommersant]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref> Aslanyan presented a new strategy of the group company development, aimed at reducing non-profitable areas (e.g. consumer electronics), funding priority scientific developments of the state (e.g., microelectronics) and manufacture optimization.<ref name=bio-sf /><ref name=strategy-cnews>{{cite web |url = http://www.cnews.ru/news/top/sitroniks_pereklyuchilsya_s_chajnikov |title = "Ситроникс" переключился с чайников на нацпроекты |author = Владислав Мещеряков |date = 2008-04-09 |publisher = CNews.ru |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref> From 2007 to 2012 Aslanyan was a minority shareholder of Sitronics with a share of 0.687% (up to 2010 – 0.25%). In January 2013, he left the company.<ref name=share-kommersant>{{cite web |url = http://quote.rbc.ru/news/merge/2007/12/24/31764276.html |title = Члены правления ОАО "Ситроникс" реализовали опцион на покупку 0,34% акций компании |date = 2007-12-24 |publisher = [[RBC Information Systems]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref><ref name="share-kommersant"/><ref name=share-annual>{{cite web |url = http://fs.moex.com/content/annualreports/662/1/sitronics-ar2010-rus.pdf |title = Годовой отчёт Sitronics, 2010 год // Совет директоров |date = 2007-12-24 |publisher = [[RBC Information Systems]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref>
In January 2013, together with a group of private investors Aslanyan acquired the company [[MaximaTelecom]] which was owned by the JSFC Sistema's [[systems integrator]] {{Interlanguage link multi|NVision Group|ru|3=Энвижн Груп|vertical-align=sup}} and became the head of its board of directors. In July 2013 MaximaTelecom took part in the auction of the [[Moscow Metro]] for the right of creating and operating Wi-Fi network in the subway trains and signed a contract as the only bidder. Investments in the project amounted to more than 2 billion rubles.<ref name=origins-vedomosti>{{cite web |url = http://www.vedomosti.ru/newspaper/articles/2013/07/29/sergej-aslanyan-svyazalsya-s-metro |title = Сергей Асланян связался с метро |author = Елизавета Серьгина |date = 2013-07-29 |publisher = [[Vedomosti]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-05 }}</ref> Since 1 December 2014 Free Wi-Fi was available on all subway lines.<ref name=1dec2014-rg>{{cite web |url = http://rg.ru/2014/12/05/internet.html |title = Пост из-под земли |author = Светлана Батова |date = 2014-12-05 |publisher = [[Rossiyskaya Gazeta]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-03-14 }}</ref>
== Awards and recognition == Aslanyan twice won ''IT-leader'' award in 2004 and 2006 in category ''Telecommunication companies'' and ''Mobile operators'' respectively.<ref name=leader-cnews>{{cite web |url = http://itleader.ru/laureate/2004/ |title = Список лауреатов премии «IT-лидер», 2004 год |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref><ref name=leader-it>{{cite web |url = http://www.cnews.ru/news/top/obyavleny_laureaty_premii_itlider_2006_goda |title = Объявлены лауреаты премии "IT-ЛИДЕР" 2006 года |date = 2006-04-24 |publisher = CNews.ru |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref> He is a winner of ''Aristos'' award, which was established by Russian Association of Managers and the publishing house [[Kommersant]] in the category ''IT-director'' (2006).<ref name=aristos-kommersant>{{cite web |url = http://www.kommersant.ru/doc/715228 |title = Российским менеджерам досталось по заслугам |date = 2006-10-21 |publisher = [[Kommersant]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref> In 2009 his name was included in the biographical reference book ''Armenian business elite of Russia'', published by scientific and educational foundation ''Erevank''.{{sfn|Дадаян|2009|с=22}} In May 2011 Aslanyan was noted among the best IT-managers of Russian Internet by the internet periodical CNews.<ref name=ed-cnews>{{cite web |url = http://biz.cnews.ru/news/top/issledovanie_cnews_gde_uchilis_luchshie |title = Исследование CNews: Где учились лучшие ИТ-менеджеры России |author = Наталья Лаврентьева |date = 2011-05-26 |publisher = CNews.ru |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref> In 2011, he received the highest index of personal reputation among top managers of telecommunication companies in the ranking developed by [[Russian News Agency TASS|TASS-Telecom]].<ref name=reputation-tass>{{cite web |url = http://tass.ru/ekonomika/499693 |title = МТС и "Вымпелком" возглавили рейтинг телекоммуникационных компаний России с лучшей деловой репутацией |date = 2011-09-01 |publisher = [[Russian News Agency TASS]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref> In September 2012 the newspaper Kommersant put Aslanyan in top-10 list of the best managers in the field of information technology in the XIII annual ranking of Russian top managers.<ref name=it-kommersant>{{cite web |url = http://www.kommersant.ru/doc-y/2025247 |title = Рейтинг высших руководителей 2012 |date = 2012-09-19 |publisher = [[Kommersant]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref>
== Personal life == Sergey Aslanyan enjoys playing [[tennis]] and [[Squash (sport)|squash]].<ref name=sq-rbc>{{cite web |url = http://style.rbc.ru/news/hobby/2015/06/08/21296/ |title = Постучишь — не оторвешься: чем объяснить популярность сквоша |author = Виктор Дятликович |date = 2015-06-08 |publisher = [[RBC Information Systems]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|2}}

{{Infobox Indian politician | image = | name = Shah Abdul Hamid | caption = | birth_date = 1890 | birth_place = [[Rangpur district]], British India | residence = | death_date = 1 May 1972 | death_place = | office = [[Speaker of the Jatiya Sangsad]] |deputy = Md Baytullah | primeminister = | term_start = 10 April 1972 | term_end = 1 May 1972<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.parliament.gov.bd/index.php/en/2013-01-22-23-24-34/list-of-speakers |title=List of Speakers |date=12 December 2012 |website=Bangladesh Parliament |accessdate=14 January 2015}}</ref> | predecessor = | successor = [[Mohammad Mohammadullah]] | office2 = | term_start2 = | term_end2 = | party = [[Bangladesh Awami League]] | spouse = | children = | website = | alma_mater = {{unbulleted list|[[University of Calcutta]]}} }}
'''Shah Abdul Hamid''' ({{lang-bn|শাহ আব্দুল হামিদ}}; 1900 – 1 May 1972) was a Bangladeshi political activist, [[Bangladesh Awami League|Awami League]] politician, legislator and banker.
==Early life== Hamid was born into a Muslim family in the village of Khalshi of Gobindagonj in [[Rangpur City|Rangpur]] district, [[East Bengal]], India, now Gaibandha, Bangladesh. His father was Hazi Abdul Gafur Shah and Mother Rahima Khatun.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://en.banglapedia.org/index.php?title=Hamid,_Shah_Abdul| title= Hamid, Shah Abdul|author= Muhammad Moniruzzaman |date=2012 |website= banglapedia |publisher= Banglapedia |accessdate= 14 January 2015}}</ref> He was awarded a bachelor of arts from Carmicheal College of Rangpur in 1920.
Hamid participated in the Non Co-operation Movement initiated by Desh Bandhu Chitta Ranjan Das. In 1927, he obtained a law degree from Calcutta University and began practice at the Court of Gaibandha.
==Professional life== {{unreferenced section|date=May 2017}} After completion of his education, he returned to Gaibandha and started working as a sports organizer. He was the General Secretary of Gaibandha Town Club. He played the pioneer role in founding the Gaibandha College in 1947 of which he became the first Secretary of the Managing Committee. He was elected Chairman of the Rangpur School Board in 1949.
He was actively associated with "Jeorge Coronation Dramatic Club" (now Gibandha Nattya Sangstha) and performed on stage.
He was Director of the National Bank of Pakistan from 1951 to 1955.
==Political life== {{unreferenced section|date=May 2017}} Shah Abdul Hamid took part in the Law defying Movement in 1930. In 1936, he joined the Muslim League. In 1941, Hamid was elected Vice Chairman of Rangpur District Board, a post he was to hold for 12 years.
In 1945, he was elected Member of the Legislative Assembly of India. He joined Bangladesh Awami League in 1956 and was the President of Rangpur Awami League up to 1966.
In 1970, representing the Awami League, he was elected member for Gobindagonj-Polashbari on the National Assembly. At the very outset of the Liberation War, he went to India and played a vital role in organizing the Resistance movement.
Hamid was the first Speaker of the Gana Parishad (National Assembly), serving from 10 April to 1 May 1972.
The [[Shah Abdul Hamid Stadium]], Gaibandha, is named in his honour.
==References== {{Reflist}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2011}}

{{Essay-like|date=May 2009}} {{Update|inaccurate=y|date=June 2012}}
The [[Office of the Telecommunications Authority]] (OFTA) is the legislative body responsible for regulating the [[telecommunications]] industry in Hong Kong. The OFTA has liberalized all telecom sectors and there are no foreign ownership restrictions.
In the local fixed-line market there is neither a pre-set limit on the number of licenses issued nor deadline for applications. {{As of|2004}}, there are nine [[fixed-line]] licensees: [[PCCW-HKT]], [[New World Telephone Limited]], [[Wharf T & T Limited]], [[Hutchison Global Crossing Limited]], [[Hong Kong Broadband Network Limited]], [[Eastar Technology Limited]], [[CM Tel. (HK) Limited]], [[TraxComm Limited]] and [[HKC Network Limited]].<ref>A. Lai, D. Murphy, "Hong Kong’s Telecommunications Industry", Stat-USA Market Research Reports. 2003</ref> Consequently, the telephone density is, with 56 lines per 100 people, among the highest in the world.<ref>"Hong Kong: The Facts. Telecommunications", Information Services Department. Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Government. 2004</ref>
{{As of|2004}} there are 197 licensed [[Internet Service Provider]]s (ISP) in Hong Kong, providing [[dial-up]] or broadband services. Hong Kong is the second after [[South Korea]] in terms of broadband penetration rate (53%).
With regard to mobile services, the OFTA awarded four [[3G]] licenses in 2001: [[Hong Kong CSL Limited]], [[Hutchison 3G (HK) Limited]], [[SmartTone 3G Limited]] and [[Sunday 3G (HK) Limited]] The first 3G mobile services were launched in January 2004.<ref>"Hong Kong: The Facts. Telecommunications", Information Services Department. Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Government. 2004</ref> Moreover, these four 3G operators, together with [[New World Mobility]] and [[Peoples Telephone Company Limited]] operate a total of eleven [[GSM]] networks. Thus the mobile density {{As of|2004|lc=on}} is one of the highest in the world (106.3%).<ref>"Hong Kong: The Facts. Telecommunications", Information Services Department. Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Government. 2004</ref>
==See also== * [[Communications in Hong Kong]] * [[Economy of Hong Kong]]

{{Infobox person | name = Valentine Rugwabiza | image = Valentine Rugwabiza, Deputy Director General of the World Trade Organisation (WTO).jpg | image_size = | caption = in 2011 as Deputy Director General of the World Trade Organisation | birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1963}} | birth_place = [[Rwanda]] | death_date = | death_place = | alma_mater = [[National University of Zaire]] | occupation = [[Economist]], [[Businesswoman]] | years_active = 1989 — present | nationality = Rwandan | ethnicity = | citizenship = Rwandan | residence = [[New York City]], [[United States]] | known_for = Business, management | networth = | home_town = | title = Rwanda's Permanent Representative
[[United Nations]] | spouse =John Paulin Sendanyoye | religion = }} '''Valetina Sendanyoye Rugwabiza''' (born 25 July 1963) is a [[Rwanda]]n businesswoman and politician who has served as the country's [[Permanent Representative]] to the [[United Nations]] since 2016. ==Early life and education== Rugwabiza was born on 25 July 1963. She has a bachelor's and a master's degree in [[Pharmacy]] from the [[National University of Zaire]].{{cite web| title=Valentine Sendanyoye Rugwabiza|url=http://grandslacsafrique.unblog.fr/2008/05/29/valentine-sendanyoye-rugwabiza/|language=French|first=Audace|last=Machado| work=Reines d'Afrique|date=29 May 2008|accessdate=11 August 2017}} ==Career== For eight years, Rugwabiza worked for Swiss [[Multinational corporation|multinational company]] [[Hoffmann-La Roche]], first as the head of commercial development and marketing for Central Africa in [[Yaoundé]] and then as regional director in [[Ivory Coast]].{{cite web| url=http://www.parliament.gov.rw/news-details/?tx_ttnews%5Btt_news%5D=215&cHash=1600dd41da53385c4775cc5659140008|title=The Senate approves Amb. Rugwabiza Valentine as RDB CEO.|publisher=Republic of Rwanda Parliament|date=17 October 2013|accessdate=11 August 2017}} She returned to [[Kigali]] in 1997 to run her own company, Synergy Group. In 2002, Rugwabiza was appointed Rwanda's [[ambassador]] to [[Switzerland]] and Permanent Representative to the UN Office in [[Geneva]], serving for three years. From 2005 until 2013, Rugwabiza was Deputy Director-General of the [[World Trade Organization]], the first woman to hold the position. She is a founding member of the Rwanda Private Sector Federation, the Rwanda Women Entrepreneurs’ Organization and the Rwandese Women Leaders’ Caucus.{{cite web|url=http://africanscholars.yale.edu/people/hon-valentine-rugwabiza|title=Hon. Valentine Rugwabiza|publisher=Yale University|work=Yale Young African Scholars|accessdate=11 August 2017}} Rugwabiza was CEO of the Rwanda Development Board from 2013–2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.theafricareport.com/East-Horn-Africa/rwandas-bet-middle-income-or-bust.html|work=The Africa Report|title=Rwanda's bet: Middle-income or bust|first=Honoré|last=Banda|date=1 July 2014|accessdate=11 August 2017}} She served as Minister for [[East African Community]] from 2014 to 2016. In 2015, she was named as one of [[Jeune Afrique]]'s "50 powerful women in Africa."{{cite web|url=http://www.jeuneafrique.com/36020/politique/rwanda-valentine-rugwabiza-de-l-omc-l-int-gration-est-africaine/|language=French|title=Rwanda : Valentine Rugwabiza, de l’OMC à l’intégration est-africaine|date=12 January 2015|accessdate=11 August 2017|first=Stéphane|last=Ballong|work=Jeune Afrique}} Rugwabiza was appointed Rwanda's Permanent Representative to the United Nations by [[List of Presidents of Rwanda|President]] [[Paul Kagame]] in November 2016.{{cite web|url=https://www.un.org/press/en/2016/bio4900.doc.htm|title=New Permanent Representative of Rwanda Presents Credentials|date=11 November 2016|accessdate=11 August 2017|publisher=United Nations}}{{cite web|url=http://www.minicom.gov.rw/index.php?id=24&tx_ttnews%5Btt_news%5D=1115&cHash=eef0f8de04657ba4a040ca53b4c3b3e9|title=Amb. Valentine Rugwabiza has handed over office to Hon. Minister François Kanimba.|publisher=Republic of Rwanda Ministry of Trade and Industry|date=7 October 2016|accessdate=11 August 2017}} She remains a member of the [[Cabinet of Rwanda]] and was a member of the [[East African Legislative Assembly]] for a five year term from 2012 until June 2017.{{cite web|url=http://www.eala.org/members/view/amb.-rugwabiza-valentine|title=Amb. Rugwabiza, Valentine|publisher=East African Legislative Assembly|accessdate=11 August 2017}} ==Personal life== Rugwabiza is married to John Paulin Sendanyoye.{{cite web|title=Valentine Sendanyoye Rugwabiza|date=11 August 2017| url=https://www.wto.org/english/thewto_e/dg_e/ddgs_e.htm#sendanyoye |publisher=World Trade Organization| accessdate=11 August 2017}} ==See also== * [[Cabinet of Rwanda]] ==Publications== * {{cite book|title=Achieving Sustainable Development and Promoting Development Cooperation: Dialogues at the Economic and Social Council|chapter=Urgency of Completing the Doha Round more Acute than Ever|pages=43–45|publisher=United Nations Publications|year=2008|url=https://books.google.com.au/books?id=2eQlD7dbQlEC|first=Valetine|last=Rugwabiza|editor=United Nations Office for ECOSOC Support and Coordination}} * {{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/global-development-professionals-network/2016/may/10/economic-integration-is-helping-boost-trade-and-investment-in-africa|title=Economic integration is helping boost trade and investment in Africa|first1=Valentine|last1=Rugwabiza|first2=Arancha|last2=González|work=The Guardian|date=11 May 2016|accessdate=11 August 2017}} * {{cite news|url=http://allafrica.com/stories/201607180343.html|title=Africa: Amidst Brexit Woes, Africa Forges Ahead With Integration|publisher=All Africa|work=The New Times|date=18 July 2016|accessdate=11 August 2017|first=Valentine|last=Rugwabiza}} * {{cite news|title=Britain may have given up on the EU dream, but Africa still wants integration|url=https://www.theguardian.com/global-development-professionals-network/2016/jul/17/britain-may-have-given-up-on-the-eu-dream-but-africa-still-wants-integration|work=The Guardian|date=17 July 2016|accessdate=11 August 2017|first=Valetine|last=Rugwabiza}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rugwabiza, Valentine}} [[Category:1963 births]] [[Category:Living people]] officials]] [[Category:Women government ministers of Rwanda]] [[Category:Rwandan businesspeople]] [[Category:Rwandan women diplomats]] [[Category:Women ambassadors]]

{{Infobox person | name = Victor Muller | image = Victor Muller.jpg | caption = | birth_name = Victor Roberto Muller<ref name=Muller>{{cite web|title=Victor Roberto Muller ''(Swedish)''|url=http://www.allabolag.se/befattningshavare/Muller%252C_Victor_Roberto_Personprofil/3e7f8e2a9685d95154178ad31277ddce|publisher=AllaBolag.se}}</ref> | nickname = VM | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1959|09|13}} | birth_place = [[Amsterdam]], [[North Holland]], Netherlands | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | residence = | nationality = [[Dutch people|Dutch]] | ethnicity = | alma_mater = [[Leiden University]] <small>([[Master of Laws|LL.M.]])</small> | employer = | occupation = [[Spyker N.V.]] <small>([[CEO]] and [[President (corporate title)|President]])</small> | salary = {{steady}} €600,000 (2012)<ref>[http://www.spykercars.com/uploads/investors/Main_elements_contract_Management_Board,18_April_2012.pdf Main elements contract member of the Management Board] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130121134604/http://spykercars.com/uploads/investors/Main_elements_contract_Management_Board,18_April_2012.pdf |date=2013-01-21 }}</ref> | predecessor = | spouse = | children = | parents = | net worth = {{decrease}} €7.5 million (2012)<ref>[http://www.spykercars.com/pdf/2012.05.21_Spyker_N.V._CEO_redusces_his_voting_interest_to_below_30_per_cent.pdf Spyker N.V. CEO corporate holdings]</ref> }}
'''Victor Roberto Muller''' (born September 13, 1959) is a [[Netherlands|Dutch]] businessman, founder of [[Spyker Cars]], [[CEO]] of [[Spyker N.V.]], and former Chairman and CEO of [[Saab Automobile|Saab Automobile AB]].<ref name=Muller />
==Education and early career== Muller studied Law at [[Leiden University]]. After graduating with an [[Master of Laws|LL.M.]] degree in 1984, he became a lawyer for the [[Amsterdam]] office of law firm [[Baker & McKenzie]]. In 1989, he joined the management team of [[offshore company]] [[Heerema]] in [[Leiden]]. A management buyout made him part owner of salvage and towing company Wijsmuller in [[IJmuiden]]. From 1992 onwards, Muller led several companies, such as ''[[Emergo Mode Groep]]'' (Emergo Fashion Group), which would be launched on the [[Amsterdam Stock Exchange]] as [[McGregor Fashion Group]].
==Spyker Cars== Muller and [[Maarten de Bruijn]] bought the name to the Dutch car company [[Spyker Cars]] in 2000, renewing the Spyker name which had been used surrounding car production in the 1920s. Muller was the CEO of the company until May 16, 2007, when he was succeeded by [[Michiel Mol]]. Muller continued to work for the company as chief designer for a period, but returned to the CEO seat later the same year, due to the split up between Spyker Cars and [[Spyker F1]] (later [[Force India]]) while Mol continued as CEO for the latter.
Muller was found guilty of sharing insider information in 2007. He sent an email to bank Theodoor Gilissen, requesting they not sell shares used as security for a personal loan. In the email Muller stated that Spyker would soon release a favourable press-release, which would increase the value of his shares. Victor Muller was initially fined €96,000. The fine was reduced in May 2012 to €11,400.<ref name="Mynewsdesk">{{cite web|url=http://www.mynewsdesk.com/se/pressroom/ekerlids_forlag_ab/pressrelease/view/ny-bok-cirkus-muller-av-jens-b-nordstroem-604968 |title=Ekerlids Förlag AB - Ny bok: Cirkus Muller av Jens B Nordström |publisher=Mynewsdesk |date=2011-03-26 |accessdate=2012-03-11}}</ref>
On 2 December 2014 Spyker NV was granted a financial restructuring by the Dutch court "Midden Nederland". Spyker needs protection from creditors for its liquidity problems. Victor R. Muller, Spyker founder and chief executive, said “Over the past few years, Spyker has faced a number of serious difficulties and challenges resulting from, among others, the legacy of the F1 era and the acquisition of Saab Automobile AB,”.<ref>{{cite web|url= https://online.wsj.com/articles/dutch-sports-car-maker-spyker-files-for-restructuring-1417539150/ |title= Dutch Sports-Car Maker Spyker Files for Restructuring|date=2014-12-02}}</ref>
On 18 December 2014 Spyker NV was declared bankrupt by the Dutch court "Midden Nederland". Victor R. Muller, Spyker founder and chief executive, said “In 2000 our objective was to found a global sports car manufacturer, and we did just that. During this time we deployed several challenging activities. These have affected the company , and contributed to our decline,”.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.bnr.nl/radio/bnr-nationale-autoshow/674396-1412/sportwagenfabrikant-spyker-failliet/ |title= Sportwagenfabrikant Spyker failliet|date=2014-12-18}}</ref>
Once in an interview with Tech Toys 360 by Channel Discovery Science, he told that the first word he said in his childhood was Car. He was interested in cars from his childhood. He started collecting cars before he got driving lincence. He was much passionated about cars that it seems he was born just for car
==Saab Automobile AB== Muller was also the chairman of the company [[Spyker N.V.|Swedish Automobile]], which was formed after the takeover of [[Saab Automobile]] by [[Spyker Cars]]. Saab Automobile was declared bankrupt in December 2011. A meeting on Saab's bankruptcy was held at the District Court of Vänersborg on the 16 April 2012. In April 2012, the Swedish curators made public that SAAB has a debt of over US$2 [[1,000,000,000|billion]] after subtracting the value of assets.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://en.konkursboet.se/ |title=Saab bankruptcy site |publisher=Konkursboet |date=December 2011 |accessdate=2012-04-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120422092741/http://en.konkursboet.se/ |archivedate=2012-04-22 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052702303772904577335704135209644 |title= Saab Auto Left $2 Billion in Debts | publisher=Wall Street Journal |date= April 2012|accessdate=2012-04-27}}</ref>
In March 2011, a Swedish biography of Victor Muller was published, [[Cirkus Muller]], by journalist [[Jens B Nordström]].<ref name="Mynewsdesk"/>
In August 2012, Muller, stated that Spyker Cars will sue General Motors over Saab's bankruptcy.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2012-08-06/spyker-sues-gm-for-3-billion-over-saab-bankruptcy.html |title='Spyker Sues GM for $3 Billion Over Saab Bankruptcy'|publisher=Bloomberg |date=2012-06-08 |accessdate=2012-06-08}}</ref> Muller, stated, "Ever since we were forced to file for Saab Automobile’s bankruptcy in December of last year, we have worked relentlessly on the preparation for this lawsuit, which seeks to compensate Spyker and Saab for the massive damages we have incurred as a result of GM’s unlawful actions". On 22 June 2013, a [[United States District Court Judge|District Court Judge]] dismissed the case. According to Judge [[Gershwin A. Drain]], "General Motors had a contractual right to approve or disapprove the proposed transaction," and "The court is going to grant the motion to dismiss the matter."<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.chicagotribune.com/classified/automotive/sns-rt-us-saab-gmbre95912l-20130610,0,2049845.story |title='Saab parent's $3 billion lawsuit vs GM thrown out by U.S. judge|publisher= Chicago Tribune |date=2013-07-06 |accessdate=2013-08-06}}</ref>
Spyker Cars NV appealed the ruling. The appeal was heard at the 6th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in Cincinnati. The court said on Friday October 24, 2014 that GM did not intentionally interfered with the Dutch company's effort to sell Saab to Zhejiang Youngman Lotus Automobile Co, leading to Saab's bankruptcy. Judge Eugene Siler said GM's actions were not malicious, and that it had "legitimate business concerns" about the sale, including who would benefit from Saab's use of its technology. Siler said that Spyker's claim was "fatally flawed".<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/10/24/us-gm-spyker-saab-idUSKCN0ID22E20141024 |title='U.S. appeals court rules for GM over Spyker's Saab sale'|publisher= Reuters|date=2014-10-24 |accessdate=2014-10-29}}</ref>
Since May 2013, Muller, has been a prime suspect of corporate tax evasion. As of 19 February 2016 Muller will be prosecuted by the Swedish tax authorities.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2013/05/22/us-sweden-saab-idUSBRE94L18420130522/|title=Sweden to summon former Saab chairman in tax inquiry|publisher=Reuters |date= May 22, 2013|accessdate=2013-05-23}}</ref>
